verse.name: v1
verse.lines: An earthly nurse sits and sings, And aye, she sings by lily wean, Sayin "little ken I my bairn's father, Far less the land where he dwells in."

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: For he came on night to her bed feet, And a grumbly guest, I'm sure was he, Saying "Here am I, thy bairn's father, Although I be not comely."

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: "I am a man upon the land, I am a silkie on the sea, And when I'm far and far frae land, My home it is in Sule Skerrie."

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: And he had ta'en a purse of gold And he had placed it upon her knee, Saying, "Give to me my little young son, And take thee up thy nurse's fee."

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: "And it shall come to pass on a summer's day, When the sun shines bright on every stane, I'll come and fetch my little young son, And teach him how to swim the faem."

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: "And ye shall marry a gunner good, And a right fine gunner I'm sure he'll be, And the very first shot that e'er he shoots Will kill both my young son and me."
